About Me

Hello! I’m Ben Bloom and I’m a Software Engineer

I have been programming since my early years in highschool. It’s fun being able to explore and discover what makes our modern technology work. Recently, my passions have been working cloud technologies and making mobile applications on iOS using native swift.

Programming Languages I like having fun with: Swift, Python, and Javascript

Techonolgies I have experience with: AWS, Serverless, Native iOS Development, ansible and git

Experience

Magellan Health

Software Engineer

February 2018 - Present

When I first join Magellan Health, I was worked on AWS and native iOS. I was responsible for creating a backend for a mobile application using serverless technologies. This was my first major introduction to AWS and the world of serverless. While I was learning and building a serverless backend, I also was assisting in the development of the front end iOS application.

After a while, I was transfered to the AWS Cloud Infrastructure team at Magellan Health. Currently, I help manage Magellan Health’s AWS accounts by helping build a centralized account managing system using ansible and cloudformation.

The Ohio State University

Student Programmer

March 2014 - December 2017

I was the head of creating matlab software to both collect and analyze subject’s data on their ability to track motion for The Ohio State’s Department of Psychology. During my time here, I used object oriented design to improve development time. What used to take weeks to create, now only takes a few days.

Healthy Roster

iOS Developer Intern

Summer 2016 and Summer 2017

As a iOS Developer Intern, I was responsible for the development of Healthy Roster’s iOS application. At the time, I was the sole developer working on the iOS application. I manage to add a variety of features to Healthy Roster’s iOS application while I was there. Some of the features included creating a secure way of collecting student athlete’s information using iOS apis for guided access and total update to the applications design, and integrating new features that connected our application to Healthy Roster’s databases.

2Checkout

Software Developer Intern

Summer 2015

During my time at 2Checkout, my primary task was to create SDKs that integrated with their new api. This included a variety of new langauges to me such as Ruby, C#, and Javscript.

Education

The Ohio State University

B.S. Computer Science and Engineering

2013 - 2017

Throughout my time at The Ohio State University, I was to explore diverse subject matter and work with very incredible people. I was able to learn many technical skills. This includes a love of security through CTFs in my information security classes, a brief introduction to AI by creating algorithms for basic image detection, and building a fitness web in my web application course.

While at Ohio State, I also had the privilege to be a member of the first class of the Integrated Business and Engineering Honors Program. This is a four year program that is designed to develop the ability to communicate across business and technical domains by bringing together a mixture of incredible students from many backgrounds

Life Outside the Code

While coding and developing software are a major passions of mine, I do like to get out and explore other things. When not on a computer, I enjoy running and working out. I feel that staying active is helps me maintain my sanity when squashing bugs in code. I also consider myself a little bit of a sneakerhead. I am always on the lookout for the newest and greatest shoe release.
